verses.text: Comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your God.
Speak ye comfortably to Jerusalem, and cry unto her, That her warfare is accomplished, That her iniquity is pardoned: For she hath received of the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* hand double for all her sins.
The voice of him that crieth in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the \sc Lord\sc*, Make straight in the desert a highway for our God.
Every valley shall be exalted, And every mountain and hill shall be made low: And the crooked shall be made straight, And the rough places plain:
And the glory of the \sc Lord\sc* shall be revealed, And all flesh shall see \add it\add* together: For the mouth of the \sc Lord\sc* hath spoken \add it\add*.
The voice said, Cry. And he said, What shall I cry? All flesh \add is\add* grass, And all the goodliness thereof \add is\add* as the flower of the field:
The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: Because the spirit of the \sc Lord\sc* bloweth upon it: Surely the people \add is\add* grass.
The grass withereth, the flower fadeth: But the word of our God shall stand for ever.

O Zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high mountain; O Jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thy voice with strength; Lift \add it\add* up, be not afraid; Say unto the cities of Judah, Behold your God.
Behold, the Lord \sc God\sc* will come with strong \add hand\add*, And his arm \add shall\add* rule for him: Behold, his reward \add is\add* with him, And his work before him.
He shall feed his flock like a shepherd: He shall gather the lambs with his arm, And carry \add them\add* in his bosom, \add And\add* shall gently lead those that are with young.

Who hath measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, And meted out heaven with the span, And comprehended the dust of the earth in a measure, And weighed the mountains in scales, And the hills in a balance?
Who hath directed the spirit of the \sc Lord\sc*, Or \add being\add* his counseller hath taught him?
With whom took he counsel, and \add who\add* instructed him, And taught him in the path of judgment, And taught him knowledge, And shewed to him the way of understanding?
Behold, the nations \add are\add* as a drop of a bucket, And are counted as the small dust of the balance: Behold, he taketh up the isles as a very little thing.
And Lebanon \add is\add* not sufficient to burn, Nor the beasts thereof sufficient \add for\add* a burnt offering.
All nations before him \add are\add* as nothing; And they are counted to him less than nothing, and vanity.
To whom then will ye liken God? Or what likeness will ye compare unto him?
The workman melteth a graven image, And the goldsmith spreadeth it over with gold, And casteth silver chains.

He that \add is\add* so impoverished that he hath no oblation chooseth a tree \add that\add* will not rot; He seeketh unto him a cunning workman To prepare a graven image, \add that\add* shall not be moved.
Have ye not known? have ye not heard? Hath it not been told you from the beginning? Have ye not understood \add from\add* the foundations of the earth?

\add It is\add* he that sitteth upon the circle of the earth, And the inhabitants thereof \add are\add* as grasshoppers; That stretcheth out the heavens as a curtain, And spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in:
That bringeth the princes to nothing; He maketh the judges of the earth as vanity.

Yea, they shall not be planted; Yea, they shall not be sown: Yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth: And he shall also blow upon them, and they shall wither, And the whirlwind shall take them away as stubble.
To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith the Holy One.

Lift up your eyes on high, And behold who hath created these \add things\add*, That bringeth out their host by number: He calleth them all by names By the greatness of \add his\add* might, for that \add he is\add* strong in power; Not one faileth.
Why sayest thou, O Jacob, and speakest, O Israel, My way is hid from the \sc Lord\sc*, And my judgment is passed over from my God?

Hast thou not known? hast thou not heard, \add That\add* the everlasting God, the \sc Lord\sc*, The Creator of the ends of the earth, Fainteth not, neither is weary? \add There is\add* no searching of his understanding.
He giveth power to the faint; And to \add them that have\add* no might he increaseth strength.
Even the youths shall faint and be weary, And the young men shall utterly fall:

But they that wait upon the \sc Lord\sc* shall renew \add their\add* strength; They shall mount up \add with\add* wings as eagles; They shall run, and not be weary; \add And\add* they shall walk, and not faint.
